title: If you drop frame rates (like 144 to 20 fps)
body:
I loaded the new client and had tons of issues.  My first game would not go over 20 fps.  I am running Win 10 at this time fully updated on the Microsoft side.  I tried practice games later and still stayed at 20 fps.

I did 2 things.  I clicked on the options wheel and selected "Close Client During Game".  And then I got the latest NVidia Drivers.  This fixed most of my FPS issues.  I've still noticed a few issues with the new client, but nothing like dropping from 144 (capped at my GSync Monitor) to 20 fps.  That should help I hope.  If I have further issues I will post my troubleshooting.  Otherwise, I hope this helped someone.  ;)

-SJ

replies.body: Double check your video settings and make sure you don't have frame rates capped.  You've done some solid steps like updating your drivers, but there could be bad game files or something else too.  Go through each step of the [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide to tune things up and get those frames back.  Let me know if you have questions!
